page.title: 13BRISTOL 47 YEARS A RESIDENT
page.content: {WESTBURY PARK Mr Higson moved to this house in 1930 at the age of six .Over the years,many young people have moved in to the area to occupy bedsitters which were once family occupied houses. Traffic is noisier now and the classes are more mixed.There is a caring community sprit with good provision for the elderly.Young people have been left with out there own organisation since the closure of the Youth Fellowship(1942-1950). Sunday is much like any other day now,more shops open,not many children go to Sunday school,people visit cinemas and theatres now and nobody bothers with wearing 'Sunday Best' the best times were 1945 to 1954.With the war restrictions lifted you could travel and have things like fireworks and not bother with blackout.
